intro: Chenolea canariensis, commonly known as the Canary Islands Chenolea, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of blue or purple. The plant grows in rocky, coastal areas and is adapted to the arid and sunny climate of its native habitat. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
